name: Remy Russell
seeking: Currently seeking remote or hybrid roles in the Salt Lake City area.
summary: An optimistic and technical product leader with three years of Product Management and seven years of Business Analysis experience evolving SaaS platforms for Health and Human Services Providers

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Platform and Integrations R&D team/pod for a configurable Case Management platform used by over 160 customers (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, etc.)
highlights: Helped drive growth in ARR by over 50% to ~$15M by expanding platform and implementation capabilities, leading to acquisition
Shipped a RESTful API from 0 to 1, onboarded developers for over ten customer organizations
Released frequent platform enhancements based on business priorities and insights (SSO & 2-Step Verification, scheduled CSV exports, no-code integration design tools, etc.)
Partnered with Engineering, Sales, Leadership, and others to maintain the roadmap, define KPIs, communicate progress, and improve implementation scalability

Delivered and scrapped POCs/MVPs for new growth initiatives and integrations (SMS/email notifications via Twilio, last-mile delivery operations via Onfleet, Health Information Exchange and Revenue Cycle Management use cases, etc.)

professionalExperience.description: Problem discovery, requirements gathering, and solutioning with customers to guide implementations on the case management platform.
highlights: Drove successful implementation for two of Eccovia's top ten largest customers by ARR, with complex data migrations and integrations
Took ownership of over a dozen integration contracts and helped transition technical strategy towards agnostic services supporting multiple customers/partners

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, UT MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: System migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a Medicaid Management Information System for the Utah Department of Health
highlights: Collaborated with customer and internal teams to produce detailed system design documents to guide development/testing of the Provider Enrollment Subsystem

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst, MI MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Analyzed program mandates published by CMS and iterated the 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution

coreSkills: Problem/solution discovery, learning from users/buyers, and owning complex challenges
Stakeholder communication and ability to articulate technical details or high-level strategy
Managing competing priorities and making data-driven decisions
Facilitating cross-functional collaboration and rapid, iterative delivery of value
Partnering and communicating with engineers (SQL proficient, basic understanding of SDLC concepts)
toolsAndFrameworks: Agile, Scrum (Jira for roadmapping, backlog refinement, Kanban workflows, sprint ceremonies, dashboards, etc.)
Workshopping and Diagramming (Confluence Whiteboards, Figjam, Lucidchart)
Mock-ups and low-fi prototyping (Figma, AI Tools)
GTM and release communication (Jira, Azure Pipelines, ReleaseNotes.io)
No or low-code API Testing and workflow automation (Zapier, Microsoft Power Automate, Postman)
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, hiking, camping/overlanding)
Podcasts/audiobooks related to science, technology, or health
